content.prompt: Complete the method traverseList in order to return a String that includes all elements of the LinkedList. The contents in the returned String must follow the order of appearance specified in the LinkedList. The structure of the custom LinkedList class has been included for you to view and understand its methods. You can assume this class represents a LinkedList of type String. Note that the String you return should not include any additional characters (i.e., no commas, spaces, etc. separating the elements).  Simply create an empty String and concatenate elements to that String as you iterate through the nodes of the LinkedList.E.g. If myList = ["3","4","5","6"], then returned myString = "3456"If myList = ["Hello","World","How","Are","You"], then returned newString = "HelloWorldHowAreYou"If myList = [""], then returned newString = ""

uses.context_name: Java: Labs401007 | Java Labs Spring 2025 - Social Comparison > Linked Lists
